schema.description: Parameters body to pass for resource name availability check.

type.description: Resource type. The only legal value of this property for checking redis cache name availability is 'Microsoft.Cache/redis'.

get.description: Gets all Redis caches in the specified subscription.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

schema.description: The response of list Redis operation.

value.description: The RedisResource items on this page

items.description: A single Redis item in List or Get Operation.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

redisConfiguration.description: All Redis Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled,rdb-storage-connection-string,rdb-backup-frequency,maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy,notify-keyspace-events, aof-backup-enabled, aof-storage-connection-string-0, aof-storage-connection-string-1 etc.

rdb-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the RDB backup is enabled

rdb-backup-frequency.description: Specifies the frequency for creating rdb backup in minutes. Valid values: (15, 30, 60, 360, 720, 1440)

rdb-backup-max-snapshot-count.description: Specifies the maximum number of snapshots for rdb backup

rdb-storage-connection-string.description: The storage account connection string for storing rdb file

aof-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the aof backup is enabled

maxfragmentationmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for fragmentation per shard

maxmemory-policy.description: The eviction strategy used when your data won't fit within its memory limit.

maxmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

maxmemory-delta.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

notify-keyspace-events.description: The keyspace events which should be monitored.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

preferred-data-persistence-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data persistence, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

authnotrequired.description: Specifies whether the authentication is disabled. Setting this property is highly discouraged from security point of view; you should never disable authentication using this property!

storage-subscription-id.description: SubscriptionId of the storage account for persistence (aof/rdb) using ManagedIdentity.

aad-enabled.description: Specifies whether AAD based authentication has been enabled or disabled for the cache

redisVersion.description: Redis version. This should be in the form 'major[.minor]' (only 'major' is required) or the value 'latest' which refers to the latest stable Redis version that is available. Supported versions: 4.0, 6.0 (latest). Default value is 'latest'.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

name.description: The type of Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: (Basic, Standard, Premium)

values.name: Basic
values.description: The well known 'Basic' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Basic SKU does not have an availability SLA.

values.name: Standard
values.description: The well known 'Standard' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Standard SKU has an availability SLA.

values.name: Premium
values.description: The well known 'Premium' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Premium SKU has an availability SLA, and higher performance tiers and more features compared with Standard SKU.

family.description: The SKU family to use. Valid values: (C, P). (C = Basic/Standard, P = Premium).

values.name: C
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'C' for Basic/Standard SKU redis caches.

values.name: P
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'P' for Premium SKU redis caches.

capacity.description: The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: for C (Basic/Standard) family (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), for P (Premium) family (1, 2, 3, 4).

subnetId.description: The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the Redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1

staticIP.description: Static IP address. Optionally, may be specified when deploying a Redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network; auto assigned by default.

provisioningState.description: Redis instance provisioning status.

values.name: Creating
values.description: A create operation is in progress.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: A delete operation is in progress.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: The cache is disabled and cannot be used.

values.name: Failed
values.description: An operation such as create or update failed. If you failed to create the cache it will not be in a usable state, so you should delete and recreate it.

values.name: Linking
values.description: Georeplication link is in progress

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: An operation is in progress

values.name: RecoveringScaleFailure
values.description: A scaling operation encountered an error and recovery is in progress.

values.name: Scaling
values.description: A scaling operation is in progress

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The most recent operation successfully completed

values.name: Unlinking
values.description: Georeplication unlink is in progress

values.name: Unprovisioning
values.description: The cache may be being disabled

values.name: Updating
values.description: An update operation is in progress.

values.name: ConfiguringAAD
values.description: An AAD configuration update operation is in progress.

primaryKey.description: The current primary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

secondaryKey.description: The current secondary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

id.description: Linked server Id.

nonSslPort.description: If enableNonSslPort is true, provides Redis instance Non-SSL port.

zone.description: If the Cache uses availability zones, specifies availability zone where this instance is located.

shardId.description: If clustering is enabled, the Shard ID of Redis Instance

isMaster.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

isPrimary.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connection associated with the specified redis cache

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

redisVersion.description: Redis version. This should be in the form 'major[.minor]' (only 'major' is required) or the value 'latest' which refers to the latest stable Redis version that is available. Supported versions: 4.0, 6.0 (latest). Default value is 'latest'.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

name.description: The type of Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: (Basic, Standard, Premium)

values.name: Basic
values.description: The well known 'Basic' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Basic SKU does not have an availability SLA.

values.name: Standard
values.description: The well known 'Standard' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Standard SKU has an availability SLA.

values.name: Premium
values.description: The well known 'Premium' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Premium SKU has an availability SLA, and higher performance tiers and more features compared with Standard SKU.

family.description: The SKU family to use. Valid values: (C, P). (C = Basic/Standard, P = Premium).

values.name: C
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'C' for Basic/Standard SKU redis caches.

values.name: P
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'P' for Premium SKU redis caches.

capacity.description: The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: for C (Basic/Standard) family (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), for P (Premium) family (1, 2, 3, 4).

subnetId.description: The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the Redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1

staticIP.description: Static IP address. Optionally, may be specified when deploying a Redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network; auto assigned by default.

provisioningState.description: Redis instance provisioning status.

maxmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

maxmemory-delta.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

notify-keyspace-events.description: The keyspace events which should be monitored.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

preferred-data-persistence-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data persistence, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

authnotrequired.description: Specifies whether the authentication is disabled. Setting this property is highly discouraged from security point of view; you should never disable authentication using this property!

storage-subscription-id.description: SubscriptionId of the storage account for persistence (aof/rdb) using ManagedIdentity.

aad-enabled.description: Specifies whether AAD based authentication has been enabled or disabled for the cache

redisVersion.description: Redis version. This should be in the form 'major[.minor]' (only 'major' is required) or the value 'latest' which refers to the latest stable Redis version that is available. Supported versions: 4.0, 6.0 (latest). Default value is 'latest'.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

name.description: The type of Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: (Basic, Standard, Premium)

values.name: Basic
values.description: The well known 'Basic' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Basic SKU does not have an availability SLA.

values.name: Standard
values.description: The well known 'Standard' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Standard SKU has an availability SLA.

values.name: Premium
values.description: The well known 'Premium' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Premium SKU has an availability SLA, and higher performance tiers and more features compared with Standard SKU.

family.description: The SKU family to use. Valid values: (C, P). (C = Basic/Standard, P = Premium).

values.name: C
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'C' for Basic/Standard SKU redis caches.

values.name: P
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'P' for Premium SKU redis caches.

capacity.description: The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: for C (Basic/Standard) family (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), for P (Premium) family (1, 2, 3, 4).

subnetId.description: The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the Redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1

staticIP.description: Static IP address. Optionally, may be specified when deploying a Redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network; auto assigned by default.

provisioningState.description: Redis instance provisioning status.

values.name: Creating
values.description: A create operation is in progress.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: A delete operation is in progress.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: The cache is disabled and cannot be used.

values.name: Failed
values.description: An operation such as create or update failed. If you failed to create the cache it will not be in a usable state, so you should delete and recreate it.

values.name: Linking
values.description: Georeplication link is in progress

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: An operation is in progress

values.name: RecoveringScaleFailure
values.description: A scaling operation encountered an error and recovery is in progress.

values.name: Scaling
values.description: A scaling operation is in progress

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The most recent operation successfully completed

values.name: Unlinking
values.description: Georeplication unlink is in progress

values.name: Unprovisioning
values.description: The cache may be being disabled

values.name: Updating
values.description: An update operation is in progress.

values.name: ConfiguringAAD
values.description: An AAD configuration update operation is in progress.

primaryKey.description: The current primary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

secondaryKey.description: The current secondary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

nonSslPort.description: If enableNonSslPort is true, provides Redis instance Non-SSL port.

zone.description: If the Cache uses availability zones, specifies availability zone where this instance is located.

shardId.description: If clustering is enabled, the Shard ID of Redis Instance

isMaster.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

isPrimary.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connection associated with the specified redis cache

values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

values.description: Reboot the primary nodes used for redis write operations. (This may trigger role changes.)

values.name: SecondaryNode
values.description: Reboot only the secondary or replica nodes

values.name: AllNodes
values.description: Reboot all nodes, not guaranteed to happen simultaneously.

shardId.description: If clustering is enabled, the ID of the shard to be rebooted.

ports.description: A list of redis instances to reboot, specified by per-instance SSL ports or non-SSL ports.

keyType.description: The Redis access key to regenerate.

values.name: Primary
values.description: The primary access key

values.name: Secondary

rdb-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the RDB backup is enabled

rdb-backup-frequency.description: Specifies the frequency for creating rdb backup in minutes. Valid values: (15, 30, 60, 360, 720, 1440)

rdb-backup-max-snapshot-count.description: Specifies the maximum number of snapshots for rdb backup

rdb-storage-connection-string.description: The storage account connection string for storing rdb file

aof-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the aof backup is enabled

maxfragmentationmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for fragmentation per shard

maxmemory-policy.description: The eviction strategy used when your data won't fit within its memory limit.

maxmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

maxmemory-delta.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

notify-keyspace-events.description: The keyspace events which should be monitored.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

preferred-data-persistence-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data persistence, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

authnotrequired.description: Specifies whether the authentication is disabled. Setting this property is highly discouraged from security point of view; you should never disable authentication using this property!

storage-subscription-id.description: SubscriptionId of the storage account for persistence (aof/rdb) using ManagedIdentity.

aad-enabled.description: Specifies whether AAD based authentication has been enabled or disabled for the cache

redisVersion.description: Redis version. This should be in the form 'major[.minor]' (only 'major' is required) or the value 'latest' which refers to the latest stable Redis version that is available. Supported versions: 4.0, 6.0 (latest). Default value is 'latest'.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

values.description: TLS protocol version 1.0 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.1 -- deprecated for security reasons. Do not use this value for new caches.
TLS protocol version 1.2 -- use this value, or higher, for new caches. Or do not specify, so that your cache uses the recommended default value

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is enabled. Connections may use any network path.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Public internet access to the cache, via its public IP address, is disabled. Connections must use be made via private endpoints.

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

name.description: The type of Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: (Basic, Standard, Premium)

values.name: Basic
values.description: The well known 'Basic' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Basic SKU does not have an availability SLA.

values.name: Standard
values.description: The well known 'Standard' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Standard SKU has an availability SLA.

values.name: Premium
values.description: The well known 'Premium' SKU for Azure Cache for Redis. Premium SKU has an availability SLA, and higher performance tiers and more features compared with Standard SKU.

family.description: The SKU family to use. Valid values: (C, P). (C = Basic/Standard, P = Premium).

values.name: C
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'C' for Basic/Standard SKU redis caches.

values.name: P
values.description: The SKU family to use - must be 'P' for Premium SKU redis caches.

capacity.description: The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values: for C (Basic/Standard) family (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), for P (Premium) family (1, 2, 3, 4).

subnetId.description: The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the Redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1

staticIP.description: Static IP address. Optionally, may be specified when deploying a Redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network; auto assigned by default.

provisioningState.description: Redis instance provisioning status.

values.name: Creating
values.description: A create operation is in progress.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: A delete operation is in progress.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: The cache is disabled and cannot be used.

values.name: Failed
values.description: An operation such as create or update failed. If you failed to create the cache it will not be in a usable state, so you should delete and recreate it.

values.name: Linking
values.description: Georeplication link is in progress

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: An operation is in progress

values.name: RecoveringScaleFailure
values.description: A scaling operation encountered an error and recovery is in progress.

values.name: Scaling
values.description: A scaling operation is in progress

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The most recent operation successfully completed

values.name: Unlinking
values.description: Georeplication unlink is in progress

values.name: Unprovisioning
values.description: The cache may be being disabled

values.name: Updating
values.description: An update operation is in progress.

values.name: ConfiguringAAD
values.description: An AAD configuration update operation is in progress.

UpdateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

values.name: Stable
values.description: Stable channel receives updates, which may include important security and stability updates, later than Preview channel.

values.name: Preview
values.description: Preview channel normally receives updates before Stable channel, and is the recommended channel for non-production workloads.

ZonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The zones for the cache will be selected automatically based on availability and capacity.

values.name: UserDefined
values.description: UserDefined means the zones for the cache are manually configured using the 'zones' property, and can not be automatically selected.

values.name: NoZones
values.description: The cache will not use multiple availability zones.
